description: Fit an SVM (Support Vector Machine) classification model to training data. SVM is a powerful, versatile machine learning algorithm used for classification and regression tasks. It works by finding a hyperplane in an N-dimensional space that distinctly classifies the data points.

parameters.name: predictors
parameters.description: The predictors for the SVM classification model as a vector data cube. These are the independent variables that the SVM algorithm analyses to learn patterns and relationships within the data.

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: The dependent variable for SVM classification. These are the labeled data, aligning with predictor values based on a shared geometry dimension. This ensures a clear connection between predictor rows and labels.

parameters.name: kernel
parameters.description: Specifies the kernel type to be used in the algorithm.

parameters.name: C
parameters.description: Regularization parameter. The strength of the regularization is inversely proportional to C. Must be strictly positive.

parameters.name: gamma
parameters.description: Kernel coefficient for 'rbf', 'poly', and 'sigmoid'. Higher values lead to tighter fits.

parameters.name: degree
parameters.description: Degree of the polynomial kernel function (only relevant for 'poly' kernel).

parameters.name: coef0
parameters.description: Independent term in the kernel function (only relevant for 'poly' and 'sigmoid' kernels).

parameters.name: cachesize
parameters.description: Size of the kernel cache in MB.

parameters.name: seed
parameters.description: A randomization seed to use for the random sampling in training. If not given or `null`, no seed is used and results may differ on subsequent use.

returns.description: A model object that can be saved with ``save_ml_model()`` and restored with ``load_ml_model()``.

links.title: C. Cortes and V. Vapnik (1995), Support-vector networks
